hints.content:
To find the difference in the pipe lengths, we start with the length of the $\purpleD{\text{school pipe}}$ and subtract the length of the $\blueE{\text{store pipe}}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7e2ae936eafd5df1fa45063a156f92cfd968d3ed)

$\purpleD{62} \text { m}-\blueE{28} \text { m}= \maroonD{\Large\Box} \text{ m}$

Let's subtract to find the difference.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b1e3d8327b1b907455a56c33a47739aab79b109d)

$\purpleD{62}\text{ m}  - \blueE{28}\text{ m}  = \maroonD{34}\text{ m}$
The difference in the lengths of the pipes is $\maroonD{34}$ $\text{m}$.

question.content:
A water pipe under a school is $62$ $\text{m}$ long. A water pipe under a store is $28$ $\text{m}$ long.  

**What is the difference in the lengths of the two water pipes?**  

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] $\text{m}$
